Package controller

Class ModifyProductController

java.lang.Object
controller.ModifyProductController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class ModifyProductController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
FXML Controller class
Initializes the ModifyProductController. A selected product can be have all fields except the ID modified. Associated parts can also be added or removed.

  • Constructor Details

    • ModifyProductController

      public ModifyProductController()

  • Method Details

    • partSearch

      public void partSearch(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Searches for parts by either partial name or part ID. If no part is found an error will be displayed stating so. If the search box is empty and the user hits the enter key, the search will return the full list of parts. Otherwise, the returned values are those that have the searched ID or contain the partial name.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - searches for the parts by partial name or ID on enter

    • transferProduct

      public void transferProduct(Product selectedProduct)
      Sets the selectedProduct data to their respective text-boxes so that the use can modify them, except for the ID. The Id can not be modified.
      Parameters:
      selectedProduct - the product that was selected for modification

    • saveButton

      public void saveButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      Saves the product being modified and returns the user to the main stage (Inventory). Before the product can be saved, conditional statements check to see if the product has improper entries and asks the user if they do want to save the product. If improper entries are entered, then errors are displayed to inform the user of what needs corrected. If the product does not have any associated parts an error will be displayed.
      LOGICAL ERROR: The user could try saving a product with a min that is higher than the max or the inventory does not fall between the min and max values. This was corrected by adding alerts that prevent the user from saving without correcting the issue.
      RUNTIME ERROR: NumberFormatException can be produced, causing the application to crash, if the user enters a value into the int text fields that is non-numerical. This has been fixed by implementing a try and catch statements. In the catch statement,when a NumberFormatException is produced, an alert is thrown instead of crashing the application.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - saves the modified product
      Throws:
      IOException - throws an error when the product can not be saved

    • addButton

      public void addButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Adds a part to AssocaitedPartTable from the part table. The user selects a part, then clicks add part. The part is then copied to AsociatedPartTable. if no part is selected before clicking add an error will be displayed.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - adds selected part to AssocaitePartTable

    • removeButton

      public void removeButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Removes associated part from the AssociatedPartTable. The user selects a part, then clicks the remove part button. If the confirmation to remove is accepted, then the part is removed from AsociatedPartTable. If no part is selected before clicking add an error will be displayed.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - removes associated part from the AssociatedPartTable

    • cancelButton

      public void cancelButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      Cancels the new product modification and returns the user to the main stage (Inventory).
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - cancels the new product creation
      Throws:
      IOException - ignore

    • modifyPartTable

      public void modifyPartTable()
      Sets the all parts to the partTable

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle rb)
      Initializes the controller class. Sets the TableView cells to their respective values from each part and associated part.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
